meanings.definition: The quality or state of being infusible.
meanings.sent1: The infusibility of the rock made it impossible to shape into a sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The infusibility of the metal made it ideal for use in high-temperature applications.
meanings.sent3: The infusibility of the ice cream caused quite a stir at the summer party.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the infusibility of steel, unyielding to any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The infusibility of the diamond made it a symbol of strength and endurance.

meanings.definition: The inability to be melted or fused.
meanings.sent1: The infusibility of the plastic meant it could not be reshaped once set.
meanings.sent2: The infusibility of the wax made it perfect for sealing envelopes.
meanings.sent3: The infusibility of the chocolate caused a comical mishap in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness was like the infusibility of a rock, refusing to budge.
meanings.sent5: The infusibility of the glue ensured a strong bond between the pieces.
